bio: I am a recent graduate from City, University of London that has completed my bachelor's degree in Computer Science. Throughout my studies I consistenly achieved above a first class grade for my modules and obtained 82.95% average for my entire degree. I have achieved a few awards with respect to my studies such as ('Outstanding Part 1 Student Award (Technical Stream)' for 'achieving an exceptionally high overall mark across their first year in the department'). I am currently looking for employment as a software developer.
transferableSkills: Problem solving is an integral part of computer science and software development. To aid me I usually make use of a whiteboard to think through the problem. An example of this is in my recent final year project in whichI had to figure out a way to correctly calculate the volume encompased by nodes. I drew a couple of configurations on the whiteboard and analysed the configurations and managed to figure out an algorithm for determining node shapes which was used to calculate the volume.

Whilst working on the team project in the second year I took the role as the lead programmer, I had to actively communicate with the rest of my team and the other programmers to divide work and help others as needed, to do this we set up a slack chat to communicate as well as setting up a GitHub repository for the project. As a result, we managed to achieve 76% overall for the module.

Time management is extremely important for individual and groups projects. To organise my work I create an overall plan for the project which has rought deadlines for key elements, and secondary plans for each of the elements to subdivide the workthroughout the weeks/months. I utilised this in my final project, at the start I created a Gantt chart for items such as research, design, implementation, testing, and analysis. At the end of each segment, I reviewed the chart to see if I was still on track andmade appropriate adjustments. I managed to complete the project in good time and achieved a first class grade.

achievements: 3rd Place for Best Graphics in 3D Graphics Module
Outstanding Part 1 Student Award (Technical Stream) from City, University of London for 'achieving an exceptionally high overall mark across their first year in the department'
